description:
Given an **undirected graph** with n vertices and m edges, check whether it contains any cycle or not.
**NOTE:** The adjacency list denotes the edges of the graph where adj[i] stores all other vertices to which ith vertex is connected.

### Example 1 

### Input
n = 5, m = 5
adj = {{1}, {0, 2, 4}, {1, 3}, {2, 4}, {1, 3}}

[![cycle-in-graph-tc1.png](https://i.postimg.cc/L8t3d7TH/cycle-in-graph-tc1.png)](https://postimg.cc/YvSWYdZV)
### Output 
```CPP 
1
``` 
#### Explanation:
1->2->3->4->1 is a cycle.
### Example 2 

### Input
n = 6, m = 4
adj = {{1},{0,2},{1},{4,5},{3},{3}} 
[![cycle-in-graph-tc2.png](https://i.postimg.cc/CKQ66X7c/cycle-in-graph-tc2.png)](https://postimg.cc/DW1gSCtG)
### Output 
```CPP 
0
``` 
#### Explanation:
No cycle in the graph.
### Constraints:

* 1 <= n,m <= 1000
title: Detect a cycle in an undirected graph
